Module imconfig
Package imconfig

Interface ConfigurationFactory

  • public interface ConfigurationFactory
    A configuration factory is responsible of creating new instances of Configuration via multiple alternative sources such as URI, classpath resources, maps, and properties objects. Any new configuration object should be created using a factory.

    On building a configuration from a external resource, the builder would autodetect the resource type (usually looking at its file extension) and treat the content properly, accepting multiple formats as JSON, YAML, XML, and .properties files.

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        static ConfigurationFactory instance()
        Returns:
        A new configuration factory

      • multivalueSeparator

        ConfigurationFactory multivalueSeparator​(char separator)
        Specify a symbol that will be used to separate different values expressed in one line. For some types of configuration load this is not necessary due to the source format has already a form of multi-value (for example, lists is YAML files), but for other types it is mandatory (e. g., expressing multi-valued properties within a map). By default, no separation will be applied.
        Parameters:
        separator - The separation symbol (cannot be \0)
        Returns:
        The same instance, for convenience

      • hasMultivalueSeparator

        boolean hasMultivalueSeparator()
        Returns:
        whether the multi-value separator has been established

      • multivalueSeparator

        char multivalueSeparator()
        Get the symbol that will be used to separate different values expressed in one line.
        Returns:
        the separator symbol, or \0 if it has not been established.

      • merge

        Configuration merge​(Configuration base,
                    Configuration delta)
        Create a new configuration composed of two other configurations. When the same property is present in two or more configurations, the value from the delta configuration will prevail (except when it has an empty value)

      • empty

        Configuration empty()
        Create a new empty configuration

      • fromPairs

        default Configuration fromPairs​(String... pairs)
        Create a new configuration from directly passed strings, using each two entries as a pair of key,value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of strings is not even

      • accordingDefinitions

        Configuration accordingDefinitions​(Collection<PropertyDefinition> definitions)
        Create a new empty configuration according the given property definitions

        Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists

        See Also:
        PropertyDefinition

      • accordingDefinitionsFromPath

        Configuration accordingDefinitionsFromPath​(Path path)
        Create a new empty configuration according the property definitions from the given path.

        Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists

        See Also:
        PropertyDefinition

      • accordingDefinitionsFromURI

        Configuration accordingDefinitionsFromURI​(URI uri)
        Create a new empty configuration according the property definitions from the given URI.

        You can use the schema 

        classpath:
        to reference classpath resources.

        Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists

        See Also:
        PropertyDefinition

      • accordingDefinitionsFromResource

        Configuration accordingDefinitionsFromResource​(String resource,
                                               ClassLoader classLoader)
        Create a new empty configuration according the property definitions from the given classpath resource.

        Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists

        See Also:
        PropertyDefinition
